term.name: panpsychism
term.source: From Greek pan: all and Greek psuche: soul.
term.def: The idea (similar to &animism;, &pantheism;, and &organicism;) that a world soul is present in everything that exists. The monadology of Leibniz (1646-1716) is one form of panpsychism, since it holds that all physical things consist of little bundles of consciousness he called monads.
